authz_code.desc: Use the Okta widget to get an authorization code and post it to the server.
authz_code.title: authz code grant flow
authz_code.user_msg_end: Success! The access token is now in the console. NOTE: in a web app (which this is) you would not normally send the access token back to the browser; it's here for demo purposes only.

implicit_flow.desc: Use the Okta widget (implicit flow) to get an id token and access token.
implicit_flow.title: implicit flow
implicit_flow.user_msg_end: Success! The tokens are in the console.

implicit_flow_access_token_only.desc: Use the Okta widget (implicit flow) to get just an access token.
implicit_flow_access_token_only.title: implicit flow - access token only
implicit_flow_access_token_only.user_msg_end: Success! The access token is in the console.

implicit_flow_id_token_only.desc: Use the Okta widget (implicit flow) to get just an id token.
implicit_flow_id_token_only.title: implicit flow - id token only
implicit_flow_id_token_only.user_msg_end: Success! The id token is in the console.

inline_hook.desc: Use the Okta widget to initiate an inline hook that will add a claim 'external_attribute' to the id token and to the access token (implicit flow)
inline_hook.instrux: Make sure that https://okta-webhooks.herokuapp.com is awake!
inline_hook.title: inline hook add claims

custom_domain.desc: use the Okta widget to get an access token from an authorization server with a custom domain
custom_domain.title: access token from custom domain

bug_custom_domain_custom_domain.title: bug: widget hangs on custom domain
